name: Introduction to Near Eastern Archaeology
description: Introduces students to the archaeological record of the Near East starting from the earliest periods to the present day.

name: Archaeological Theory and Methodology
description: Focuses on the development of archaeological theory and its application to archaeological methods, such as excavation, survey, and analysis.

name: Archaeology of Ancient Near East I and II
description: Studies the rise of civilization in the Near East, beginning with the Paleolithic and ending with the Iron Age.

name: Near Eastern Archaeology Field School
description: Provides hands-on training in archaeological field methods, including excavation, survey, and mapping.
prerequisites: Archaeology of Ancient Near East I and II

name: Advanced Archaeological Theory and Methodology
description: Builds upon the theories and methods introduced in Archaeological Theory and Methodology, with a focus on advanced techniques and critical analysis.

name: Near Eastern Archaeology Seminar
description: Studies archaeological research topics in the Near East through lectures, discussions, and independent work.
prerequisites: Archaeology of Ancient Near East I and II
